SENT.plain: Dural sinus thrombosis (DST) is rarely associated with spontaneous intracranial hypotension (SIH)

Engorgement of the venous system, caused by the CSF loss that occurs in SIH, is considered to favour the thrombosis, although signs of both SIH and DST are usually seen simultaneously at the first diagnostic MRI
We observed two patients with SIH and DST
Changes in pattern of headaches and MRI findings demonstrated that DST followed SIH
In SIH, the velocity of the blood flow in the dural sinuses may be reduced because of dilatation of the venous system which compensates the CSF loss
Other possible mechanisms seem unlikely on the grounds of both clinical presentation and MRI studies
